head.citation-title: A Buddhist Gift Enigma: Exchange in Vessantara’s Bodhisattvic Perfection of Giving
head.abstracts: © 2017, Springer International Publishing Switzerland.Suwanna Satha-Anand addresses the controversial topic of the “Great Giving” by Prince Vessantara (one of the past births of the Buddha). The Prince’s “giving away” of his wife and children initiates a debate as to whether this is a commercial exchange or the “Perfection of Giving,” insofar as it is enacted without any anticipation of recompense. Satha-Anand investigates diverse dimensions of the question, concluding with its implications for women which still exist today.

coredata.dc:description: Suwanna Satha-Anand addresses the controversial topic of the “Great Giving” by Prince Vessantara (one of the past births of the Buddha). The Prince’s “giving away” of his wife and children initiates a debate as to whether this is a commercial exchange or the “Perfection of Giving,” insofar as it is enacted without any anticipation of recompense. Satha-Anand investigates diverse dimensions of the question, concluding with its implications for women which still exist today.
